intro: Xanthoxalis chrysantha, commonly known as golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Xanthoxalis chrysantha is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
